channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tate Brothers, Facing Sex Crime Inquiries, Arrive in Florida From Romania
item.description: The abrupt departure of Andrew and Tristan Tate, who had been held in Romania for two years, raised questions about whether the Trump administration h...

item.title: Tesla Fires a Manager Who Criticized Elon Musk on Social Media
item.description: The employee objected to a post on X by Mr. Musk, Tesla’s chief executive and a top adviser to President Trump, that referred to Nazi leaders.

item.title: A U.K. Teen’s Parents Sent Him to Ghana. He Took Them to Court.
item.description: Fearing their son was becoming involved in a gang, a London teenager’s parents tricked him and left him in Ghana. He sued, but a court sided with his ...

item.title: With Trump, Alliances Come With Strings Attached
item.description: President Trump has little use for America’s traditional alliances, and tends to evaluate U.S. relationships according to whether countries are contri...

item.title: In Greenland, Taking It All In With Snowy Jogs and Sled Dogs
item.description: On a nearly two-week reporting trip to the island, one Times reporter made time for exercise and ice fishing.

item.title: Gene Hackman, Hollywood’s Consummate Everyman, Dies at 95
item.description: The winner of two Oscars, he was hailed for his nuanced performances in films like “The French Connection,” “Unforgiven” and “The Royal Tenenbaums.”

item.title: Boris Spassky, Chess Champion Who Lost ‘Match of the Century,’ Dies at 88
item.description: When Mr. Spassky, a Russian, played Bobby Fischer, an American, in Iceland at the height of the Cold War, the media attention reduced them to pawns in...

item.title: Meet the Trans Troops the Trump Administration Is Barring
item.description: Officers and enlisted. Combat veterans and recent recruits. Transgender service members say their military experience has looked nothing like the port...

item.title: Will a 24-hour ‘economic blackout’ make a difference? Why shoppers are shunning Amazon, Walmart, and Whole Foods
item.description: A grassroots organization is encouraging U.S. residents not to spend any money on Feb. 28 as an act of “economic resistance."

item.title: Target is trying to rekindle shoppers’ passions with Warby Parker and Champion collaborations
item.description: The cheap-chic retailer has fallen way behind Walmart, but has a plan.

item.title: Jamie Dimon’s RTO mandate won’t fix his remote-work rant’s key complaints. Here’s what will
item.description: CEOs like Dimon should ease up on RTO and undertake a purposeful reengineering of the old ways of work.

item.title: I Loved ‘Anora,’ but I Still Hope It Loses at the Oscars
item.description: “Anora” is neither pro-Russian nor anti-Russian. But its Oscar nominations have been portrayed as a national victory in Russia.

item.title: Friday Briefing: Trump Met With Britain’s Leader
Early mRNA vaccine trial results show potential breakthrough in fighting one of the deadliest cancers
item.description: “The latest data from the phase 1 trial are encouraging,” said the study's lead author.

item.title: The legacy media is dead. Long live the legacy media
item.description: Our shared reality has always come from a mix of media, and once a medium has been instantiated, it never really goes away.
